item.title: Introspection Ramblings
item.description:
Everyone has problems of some type. It’s likely that others have had very similar problems with a solution to those problems. My goal in these articles will be to tackle a problem. Solution or not. I’d like to be able to reflect on my values and goals, what I do and don’t enjoy doing, how I feel about my expectations versus reality, and my insecurities and who I am.

My Values and Goals

        

What I know I Do and Don’t Enjoy

        I’ve always struggled at realizing I don’t enjoy being around certain people and what I do with those people. I’ve end up hanging with friends from a long time ago that I left for a very good reason and absolutely hating doing things with them. I was bored to death and felt like it was ruining my reputation being around them. Sadly, my inner defense mechanisms seemed to support this attitude towards hanging out with these people. I would forget to spend more time with people I do enjoy being around, or even just spending more time alone. I would hide behind my insecurities and avoid people I really do enjoy being around.

Insecurities

        My insecurities suck. They literally pull me away from the people I find the most interesting out of fear that I’m not prepared for their awesomeness. Already being an socially anxious individual, most of my insecurities are detrimental to my health. They make it really hard to make new, high value friends. I will definitely write about how I plan to fix this insecurity and become a more socially acceptable human being. Of course this is me expecting this blog to help me overcome my fear of meeting really cool people and putting myself out there and exploring more opportunities.

Expectation Versus Reality

        I hate setting expectations. It’s also nearly impossible to avoid setting expectations and even more impossible to make expectations that match reality. I really want to narrow the gap between the expectations I make and what actually occurs out of those expectations. I plan to use writing as a tool to narrow that gap and get more enjoyment from controlling my expectations.

        I really look forward to writing about how I feel about myself and the things I accomplish. I’m almost certain I could greatly improve my life by reflecting on what works and what doesn’t. That’s exactly what the introspection category of my blog will contain and I hope it will help me build character and meet tons of cool and interesting people.

item.title: About
item.description:
*The website is mostly temporary at the moment. The blog posts will be kept, but everything else is likely to change.

        Welcome to the one and only Timothy Ford’s blog website! You can find my interests scattered around in four different categories found in the navigation bar at the top of the page. I feel these four different categories sum up the things I can easily talk about and share with others. They include, but aren’t limited to introspection, history and religion, nerdy stuff, and my adventures such as traveling.

1. Introspection

        My life is filled with confusing and complicated problems constantly demanding to be solved. I mean whose life isn’t? Here is where I will put my reflections on life and explorations of what I do and don’t enjoy for the world to decipher through and maybe learn from. My goals and aspirations will also be found here. Find more about my feelings towards introspection and what can be found here at this link.

2. History/Religion

        I wouldn’t say I have a strong interest in either history or religion. However, I am intrigued by how they are related and what they can teach individuals. I believe there is more to history and religion than what is taught in primary and secondary schools and should be explored as an individual more. More on what can be found here and why I find it important can be found at this link.

3. Nerdy Stuff

        So many things can fit into this category I don’t even know where to start. I have many nerdy interests. I enjoy just about anything to do with a computer and can’t use the devilious Windows operating system without crying. Linux is always my go-to operating system and it fits my programming and electrical mind far more than the bloatware Microsoft offers. Games and game development can also be found here. To find out the full extent of my nerdiness look at this link.

4. My Adventures

   &nbsp    ;I love the outdoors. Rain, snow, sleet, or hail I can be found outside running, hiking, biking, or just in general exploring the world. I plan to do some traveling one day and I have some very wierd, strong, and cheap views on living style that I wish to someday live. More information on my absurd living style and other outdoorsy things can be found at this link.

    I hope my overthought introspection ramblings, random history and religious thoughts and explorations, nerdy and scholarly writings, and my crazy adventures are entertaining and worth the read. Feel free to ask questions and write comments in the comments at the bottom of the posts. Thank you so much!
